overview: At the beginning of the 1920s, Pauline Brunius directed a series of short light comedies - or as she herself describes them "finer games of pleasure with a bit of esprit, maybe also a bit of emotion". She herself wrote the scripts for the films about the charming Stockholm family Winner, where the parents were played by married couple Frida and Olof Winnerstrand and the son Putte by Pauline and John Brunius' own son Palle.
title: Herr Vinners stenåldersdröm
